meanings.definition: The state or quality of being prime.
meanings.sent1: The primality of the number 7 is evident in its inability to be divided by any other number except 1 and itself.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study the primality of numbers to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was based on the primality of the color gold, with everything shimmering and shining.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the primality of a color can greatly impact the overall mood of a painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to explain the concept of primality to the students, making it easy to remember.

meanings.definition: The property of a number being prime.
meanings.sent1: The primality of the number 2 is fundamental in understanding even and odd numbers.
meanings.sent2: When studying cryptography, one must consider the primality of certain key numbers.
meanings.sent3: The primality of the number 13 seemed to bring good luck to the lottery winner.
meanings.sent4: The primality of a number can be compared to the uniqueness of a rare gemstone.
meanings.sent5: The primality of prime numbers makes them essential in many mathematical calculations.
